newsitem.title: DUBAI: UAE ponders $2 billion German petrochemical project.
newsitem.headline: UAE ponders $2 billion German petrochemical project.

text.p: The United Arab Emirates is studying a proposal by German chemicals giant BASF AG to set up a $2 billion petrochemicals project in Dubai, an official said in remarks published on Saturday.

The UAE's Al-Khaleej newspaper quoted Dubai Economic Department general director Mohammed al-Abbar as saying ..."the government is currently studying a giant petrochemicals project with an investment value of about $2 billion that well-known German company BASF is proposing to set up in Dubai."

The UAE made a dramatic if late entry into the petrochemicals business last year by signing a joint-venture deal worth more than $1 billion with Scandinavia's Borealis to build a 450,000-tonnes-a-year polyethylene plant in the emirate of Abu Dhabi.
Borealis is a 50-50 venture between Finland's Neste Oy and Norway's Statoil.
The UAE, like other Gulf Arab states, is eager to limit its direct exposure to international oil prices by diversifying its oil-driven economy.
